meanings.definition: Unwanted transfer of signals between communication channels.
meanings.sent1: The crosstalk between the phone lines caused interference with the internet connection.
meanings.sent2: During the meeting, there was so much crosstalk that it was hard to follow the main discussion.
meanings.sent3: The crosstalk between the radio stations made it sound like the songs were talking to each other!
meanings.sent4: The crosstalk of ideas in the brainstorming session created a symphony of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The crosstalk of voices in the crowded room was like a chaotic orchestra playing out of tune.

meanings.definition: Conversation or discussion between two or more people.
meanings.sent1: The crosstalk at the party made it difficult to hear individual conversations.
meanings.sent2: The crosstalk between the siblings was filled with laughter and shared memories.
meanings.sent3: The crosstalk at the family dinner sounded like a lively debate between food and drinks!
meanings.sent4: The crosstalk of opinions in the classroom was like a colorful tapestry of ideas.
meanings.sent5: The crosstalk of voices in the park created a cheerful background noise.
